description: From the Latin sēnārius (“consisting of six each”), from sēnī (“six each, six at a time”) + -ārius (whence the English suffix -ary).

examples: In particular, one can construct mixed binary/ternary codes via senary codes by applying the Chinese Gray map (see Example 1).

entries.meaning: (arithmetic) Of, pertaining to, or based on six.
examples: The senary fraction 0.2 is one-third, i.e. two-sixths.

entries.meaning: (arithmetic) The numeral system which uses six as the base.
